qas.question: When did Artcle 3 of the Treaty of San Francisco come into effect?
How many people lived on the island of Okinawa?
Why did the US have troops on Okinawa?
When did Article 2 of the Treaty of San Francisco come into effect?
How many people lived on the island of Bonin?
When was San Francisco finally returned?
Why did the Japanese have troops on Okinawa?
Who put the outlying islands of the Ryukyus into Bonin trusteeship?

context: In Article 3 of the Treaty of San Francisco between the Allied Powers and Japan, which came into force in <a0_0><b4_0>April 1952<b4_0/><a0_0/>, <b8_0>the U.S.<b8_0/> put the outlying islands of the Ryukyus, including the island of Okinawa—home to <a1_0><b5_0>over 1 million<b5_0/><a1_0/> Okinawans related to the Japanese—and the Bonin Islands, the Volcano Islands, and Iwo Jima into U.S. trusteeship. All these trusteeships were slowly returned to Japanese rule. Okinawa was returned on <a2_0><b6_0>May 15, 1972<b6_0/><a2_0/>, but the U.S. stations troops in the island's bases <a3_0><b7_0>as a defense for Japan<b7_0/>.
